# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[!, :ym] = [string(year(d), leadingzeros(3 - length(string(month(d)))), month(d)) for d in df.dt]
    return df
end
```

This function iterates over the `dt` column of the `DataFrame` and extracts the year (`year(d)`) and month (`month(d)`) for each element `d` in the column. It then formats the month as a string with leading zeros to ensure a fixed width of 3 characters, concatenates them together as an integer using string concatenation, and assigns this new `ym` value back to the `DataFrame`. Finally, it returns the updated `DataFrame` with the new column added.
